alert.note: Alert for Burnet; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 1:54PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Williamson and central Burnet Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 154 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Liberty Hill, or near Bertram, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bertram, Leander, Liberty Hill, Mahomet, Joppa, Andice, Oatmeal and Shady Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
